meanings.definition: To remove a bruise or discoloration from the skin.
meanings.sent1: She used a special cream to debruise the mark on her arm.
meanings.sent2: After a few days, the bruise started to debruise on its own.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could debruise a bruise with a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a magic potion that could debruise any bruise.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to debruise the dark spot on the carpet.

meanings.definition: To heal or repair damage to the skin caused by bruising.
meanings.sent1: The ointment helped debruise the injury on her knee.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the skin will debruise and return to normal.
meanings.sent3: He believed his grandma's soup could debruise any wound.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted like a balm to debruise his emotional scars.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of the nurse seemed to debruise the patient's skin.
